question: How fast can you get the swine flu?
question_content: So i know that most of you are sick of hearing about the swine flu because i know that i am. lol but im a bit worried about it because i just came back from cabo san lucas mexico 12am saturday. im not sure if im just being a hypochondriac but i have a little cough and i've had diahhrea (it might be from the food in mexico, i didn't like it that much) and im scared it might become into a bigger cold, and possibly the swine flu. so, how long will it take for you to get sick after you've been infected by the swine flu?

answers.answer_content: Did you kiss any pigs down there? If not I wouldnt worry about it.

"How to heal Swine flu faster? What can quicken the healing process?" Like I said before when you posted this question the first time, TIME. Take care of yourself and treat your symptoms and you could be ready. The duration of swine flu is up to 7 days with an average of 4. You were infected 2-4 days before you even had symptoms. I don't know how long you had symptoms before seeing a doctor and getting your diagnosis but you know this and you can do some simple math and make an estimate. Try to refrain from making multiple postings of the same question. That's a no-no.

keep your hand away from your eyes,mouth,open cuts, and always wash your hand. the swine flu is a virus which means it can only enter threw those particular areas. I don't think you have it. You said you got back Saturday? well if you did the flu would of already started. Trust me if you had it you would know it.

It would still be good to get your self checked out and to cover you mouth, not using your hand using your arm. Always wash your hands.
your fine.
EDIT: as of now scientist have no clue how fast the virus spreads. They believe it takes the same amount of hours that a normal flu does. If you have it, there is nothing to be worried about. the only reason why people were dieing in Mexico is because Mexico has BAD health care. Were in America, we have cures. 3 kids had and and now there fine. IM pretty sure you don't have it.

Go to the Doctor, ASAP!! The symptoms you described sounds like they could be a number of things, including but not limited to: food poisoning, spicy food, a cold, or...the dreaded Swine Flu! I recommend to know for sure, ask the doctor to check it out, or at least go to to the Minute Clinic at CVS. Good Luck, I hope you feel better!!

Scientist don't know for sure how it spread, 
or how fast it spread.
